properties.title: Observation Post
properties.name: Constables Farm
properties.description: Spike spent a week each month at this location.

properties.title: Anecdote
properties.name: Bexhill Cemetery
properties.description: While stationed at nearby Mill Wood Spike used a tap in the cemetery for his ablutions. The cemetery was also where an inebriated comrade was deposited.

properties.title: Gun Position
properties.name: Mill Wood
properties.description: In 1941, 'D' Battery moved to a ‘specially selected’ muddy disused rubbish tip called Mill Wood.

properties.title: Billet
properties.name: Grammar School
properties.description: 'D' Battery was billeted in Turkey Road Girls' School along with a WVS canteen van and a piano. From here, the band ran their own dances.

properties.title: Gun Position
properties.name: Wrestwood Road
properties.description: A photo taken of Spike (top row, left) and friends is thought to be sited here. The gun pointing out to the coast.

properties.title: Billet
properties.name: Worthingholm
properties.description: A private school that had been requisitioned and used as the Headquarters of 'D' Battery 56th Heavy Regiment.

properties.title: Anecdote
properties.name: St. Peter's Church
properties.description: A drum kit was found in the church and was requisitioned for the band’s use.

properties.title: Music Venue
properties.name: St. Peter's Church Hall
properties.description: The site of the band’s first gig was in this hall. The dance was a sell-out, and the bar did roaring business.

properties.title: Observation Post
properties.name: Galley Hill
properties.description: Spike spent a week each month at this location.

properties.title: Reunion
properties.name: Manor Gardens
properties.description: In May 1988 the Prince of Wales landed at the St Richard’s School playing fields to attend an informal visit to the Manor Barn where he attended the Royal Artillery’s 56th Heavy Regiment, 'D' Battery dinner.

properties.title: Music Venue
properties.name: Granville Hotel
properties.description: The Granville was the scene of many 'D' Battery dances.

properties.title: W.V.S. Forces Corner
properties.name: Sydenham House Cafe
properties.description: The Women’s Voluntary Service ran the Forces Corner café which 'opened for tea, buns, billiards, ping-pong and deserters' and was frequented by Spike.

properties.title: Music Venue and Reunion
properties.name: De La Warr Pavilion
properties.description: Spike and his band played here regularly. In later years the Pavilion was the venue for 'D' Battery’s Annual Reunions and where Spike was ambushed for an episode of the television programme This Is Your Life.

properties.title: Exhibition
properties.name: Bexhill Museum
properties.description: In 1989 Spike attended the Museum’s Bexhill At War exhibition.

properties.title: Sports
properties.name: Polegrove
properties.description: The 1941 Southern Command Sports Day was a military athletics tournament held at Polegrove. The Battery played rugby and Spike received eye injuries.

properties.title: Sculpture
properties.name: Glyne Gap
properties.description: Portrait Bench unveiled 2012 of local heroes. The figures of Spike Milligan, Richard Ball and Tyrone Wildman are cut from sheet steel and were inspired and chosen for their individual contribution to the life of the local community.

properties.title: Anecdote
properties.name: Bowrey Place
properties.description: A house here was a popular stop over for lunch with the Barden family.

properties.title: Music Venue
properties.name: Sussex Hotel
properties.description: Spike and his band played often here.
